page.title: 15A WINTER WALK IN BERGHOLT
page.content: I WALKED DOWN CHITTS HILL IN THE POURING RAIN AND WIND,I WAS ON MY WAY TO SCHOOL.TRICKLING DOWN THE SIDES OF THE ROAD IS A LITTLE STREAM;I TURN ROUND AND LOOK UP THE HILL TO SEE WHERE IT'S COMING FROM.THE SKY IS DARK GREY AND THE TREES ARE BENDING AND CREAKING AS IF THEY ARE GOING TO FALL DOWN.WHEN I GET TO THE BOTTOM OF THE HILL I STOP AND WATCH THE RIVER FLOW;IT HAS A STRONG CURRENT AND THE SWIRLING OF THE WATER MAKES IT MISTY.I PICK UP A STICK AND THROW IT.IT LANDS A LITTLE WAY UP THE RIVER, THEN GETS CAUGHT IN THE CURRENT AND CARRIED ALONG.I WATCH THE COWS SEEK SHELTER UNDER THE TREES AND NIBBLE THE HEDGES.I START TO WALK UP THE HILL WHEN I'M STOPPED BY A PERSON TO ASK ME THE WAY TO A FARM;I TELL HIM AND WALK ON.THE ROAD IS MUDDY AND EVERYTHING IS WET.THE PHONE BOX LOOKS LIKE IT'S NEW.
